text: it's just far here at AWS in Seattle and
our three launch announcements this week
cover Amazon ec2 convertible reserved
instances AWS CloudFormation and AWS
private Lake for Amazon services first
this week our ec2 convertible reserved
instances are now available in a one
year term in addition to the original
three-year term we've also improved the
exchange process by making it possible
to exchange a portion of reserved
instance as well as merge the value from
multiple reserve instances for use in a
single exchange next up eight notice
CloudFormation increase the number of
stack instances you can create per stack
set to manage your AWS resources before
you could create a maximum of 50 stack
instances per stack set but now that max
is 500 stack instances per stack set
this means you can provision more stack
instances across accounts and regions
from a single template with a single
operation and lastly with AWS private
link you can now privately access Amazon
services from Amazon virtual private
cloud without using public IP
this means network traffic doesn't have
to traverse the internet private link
removes the need to whitelist public IP
s because it keeps all the traffic
within the AWS network thanks for tuning
in for this week's new launches at AWS
for the full slate of our latest
launches check out our what's new page
also please feel free to follow me on
Twitter and read the AWS blog we'll see
you next week
you
[Applause]
